How to Prepare for Youth Conference

The best way to get the most out of youth conference is to prepare now.  Review the packing list to make sure that you have everything you need for the conference. The 2012 Mutual theme and the theme for this conference is "Arise and Shine Forth."  You can watch this video of the theme song to better get you in the spirit to "Arise and Shine Forth."  The Church has also produced other media for the 2012 theme that will inspire you as you prepare.

The For the Strength of Youth pamphlet counsels us to "study the scriptures each day and apply what you read to your life" (p. 42).  If you don't have a copy of this pamphlet you can get a digital version (PDF) from the Church's website.  Starting on Sunday, June 10th, if you read 10 pages a day you will finish the Book of Mormon by the start of the conference.  We would encourage you to accept this challenge and make daily scripture study a part of your life.

Here are some events to be aware of and what you can do to prepare for them.

  • Talent show - Get ready to share your talents!  On Saturday the winners of the stake and ward talent shows will have an opportunity to bring joy into the lives of others as they perform for the particpants of the conference.
  • March to the temple - Watch the 2012 theme song video.  Read Isaiah 2:2, and review the material the Church has produced on temples.  These frequently asked questions might helpe inspire you.  The Stakes are challenging the youth to memorize the The Living Christ,  and it is central to the March to the Temple event. Elder Bednar gave a great talk on temples in the October 2011 General Conference.  As always, sharing these things with your friends is a great way to learn.  Your non-member friends might especially like this video on why Mormons build temples.
  • Exercise - There will be a morning exercise program during the conference.  The Church's For the Strength of Youth pamphlet counsels youth "to care for your body, eat nutritious food, exercise regularly, and get enough sleep" (p. 25).  Study the Physical and Emotional Health section of For the Strength of Youth to better understand how you can live a more healthy life. Please be aware of the dress code at BYU-Idaho as explained below:
    • Activity and Recreational Attire
      Dress standards for each event will be specified prior to the event. If no standard is indicated, the minimum standard will be campus attire. Modest casual attire may be worn at certain activities and events. Shorts and other pants ending above the ankle are inappropriate for campus. Shorts are only allowed at playing fields and must be modest in length. Traveling across campus to activities in shorts is not appropriate.
    • In other words, youth must dress modestly at all times. Proper workout attire is a t-shirt and shorts that end at the knee.
  • Dance - To help you prepare for the dance on Friday night study and ponder the Music and Dancing (p. 22) section of For the Strength of Youth.
